name: WiDNR 2015
tagline: Materials for "Introduction to R using the FM Database" et al. at the WiDNR Statewide Meeting, 2-Mar-15
body:
This two-day workshop will provide an introduction to R for fisheries biologists and technicians in the Wisconsin DNR.  R concepts and methods will be introduced through the use of data from the Fisheries Management Database.  The focus of this course, however, will be on developing foundational skills in R that can be transferred to other situations.  Participants will test application of their knowledge with hands-on exercises using their own data extracted from the FM Database.

## Pre-Course Preparation
Perform the following tasks before the workshop.
* [Install R and RStudio](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Course_Prep/Installations.pdf) — Complete with the help of the State IT consultants.
* [Preparing R and RStudio](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Course_Prep/PreparingRStudio.pdf) — The directions in this link will make sure that your R and RStudio can use all special purpose programs required for the workshop.
* [Getting Started with RStudio](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Course_Prep/RStudio_GenningStarted.pdf) — Review the material in this link to get a feel for the primary software used in the workshop.
* Create a Workshop Folder — Create a folder on your computer that will contain all materials from the workshop (for those described in the next two bullets and created at the workshop).
* Download Materials — Download (put in the folder created above) all scripts below and the data files for the “Introduction to Linear Models” on the second day.
* Get FM Data — Instructions for pulling data from the FM database for your county were sent to you in an e-mail (on 21-Feb) and are in the central FH_PROJECTS location (\\central\Water\FH_PROJECTS\SV_ContinuingEducation\R Workshop).  If you do not have data in the FM database, then you can use a pull from Sawyer County that is in the same location on the WiDNR network.

Please [contact me](mailto:dogle@northland.edu) with any questions.  If you wish to install R and RStudio on a personal (non-state) computer, then let me know and I can provide you with directions.

## Course Materials — Day 1
* Introduction to R and RStudio
  * [Slides](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/00_Introduction.pptx)
* Loading Data into R
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/01_LoadData.pdf) // [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/A01_LoadData.R)
* Filtering Data.frames
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/02_FilterData.pdf) // [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/A02_FilterData.R)
* Adding New Variables
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/03_MutateData.pdf) // [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/A03_MutateData.R)
* Size Structure I
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/04_SizeStructure_I.pdf) // [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/A04_SizeStructure_I.R)

## Course Materials — Day 2
* Size Structure II
  * [Handout](https://github.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/raw/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/05_SizeStructure_II.pdf) // [Script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/droglenc/courseWiDNR2015/master/Day1_IntroR_FMData/A05_SizeStructure_II.R)
* Examine Age Data
  * Handout // Script
* Create and Apply an Age-Length Key
  * Handout // Script
* Summarize Age Data
  * Handout // Script
* Introduction to Linear Models
  * Handout // Script // RuffeSLRH.CSV // BLGLW.CSV
* The Future
  * Rmarkdown Example
  * Shiny Example
  * Bioenergetics (another Shiny Example)

## Follow-Up
* Please complete this survey regarding this workshop.
* Following the course, please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

** Referenced Websites
* fishR
* General Help — [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/r)
* Color-related — [colorBrewer](http://colorbrewer2.org/), [named colors](http://www.stat.columbia.edu/~tzheng/files/Rcolor.pdf)
* Learning Resources — [Reference Card](http://cran.r-project.org/doc/contrib/Short-refcard.pdf), [data wrangling cheatsheet](http://www.rstudio.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/data-wrangling-cheatsheet.pdf), [Quick-R](http://www.statmethods.net/)
* [Math Functions](http://www.stats4stem.org/r-math-functions.html)
